name: Grilled Chicken (gai yang)
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup scraped and chopped coriander root,
1 cup long red chilies (deseeded if desired),
recipeInstructions: 1. Using a pestle and mortar, pound the coriander roots, salt, garlic, and peppercorns into a fine paste.
2. Cut the chicken in half along the breastbone, flatten out, wash and dry. Work in the paste, fish sauce and sugar, and leave to marinate for a few hours.
3. For the sweet chilli sauce, pound the coriander root, salt, garlic and chilies into a paste.
4. Combine the vinegar, sugar, water, and salt in a pot and bring to the boil.
5. Add the paste and stir to dissolve. Simmer the sauce until reduced by half, skimming as necessary, then set aside to cool.
6. Chargrill the chicken for 15-20 minutes, turning regularly. Serve with a bowl of the sauce.
